intro: Acharagma roseanum subsp. roseanum, commonly known as the roseanum subshrub, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pink flowers, which are typically arranged in cymes. Its foliage is usually covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy appearance. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
